intro: Aeollanthus rydingianus, commonly known as the Ryding's aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Aeollanthus rydingianus is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
